meanings.definition: Relating to the formation and development of the structure of an organism.
meanings.sent1: The morphogenic process in plants determines how they grow and take shape.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the morphogenic aspects of embryos to understand development.
meanings.sent3: The morphogenic changes in the tadpole were so rapid, it seemed like magic!
meanings.sent4: Her influence on the team was morphogenic, shaping their approach to problem-solving.
meanings.sent5: The artist used morphogenic patterns to create a stunning visual effect on the canvas.

meanings.definition: Having the ability to cause changes in the shape or structure of cells or tissues.
meanings.sent1: Certain chemicals have a morphogenic effect on cell growth.
meanings.sent2: The medication's morphogenic properties help in tissue regeneration.
meanings.sent3: The morphogenic power of the potion turned the frog into a prince!
meanings.sent4: His words had a morphogenic impact on her perspective, reshaping her thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The storm's morphogenic force reshaped the coastline dramatically.
